reviews.review_msg: An old-schooled professor. Mostly likes to read through the slides during classes, which makes a 400-level class dry. I personally didn't like this teaching style.
Don't take a course with him if someone else is offering the same course. Anywhere. Ever. You're welcome.

Dr. Perl is a very knowledgeable professor. He is caring and humorous. Dr. Perl provides clear and helpful feedback in assignments and during 1 on 1 consultations to assist students in better understanding the criteria required to earn a better mark. Despite only receiving a B (personal reasons), the course is as expected for a 400 Writing course.

I took two different classes with Prof. Anthony, URB 660 - Transportation, and URB 655 - Global Cities. I was really impressed by his commitment and ability to drive the students towards new knowledge. He provides excellent and unique feedbacks and promotes lots of productive discussions and interactions among students.

The course content wasn't what I was expecting, and unfortunately I found it really drybut it was bearable enough. He has a tendency to ramble in lectures and his slides are pointlessthe book is way better at explaining things. Really nice guy tho Also no idea how he arrived at grades he did. No tests and episodes of Yes Minister were pluses.
I took this class and received a good mark and hid class was fun. I learned so much from the yes minister shows and class discussions. I wish he taught more classes.
The best professor at SFU in every single way, period.

Dr. Perl is an excellet prof. I would call him the "Transport Supremo" because he is one of the expert in the world in the area of transportation. If you are interested in transportation research then he is the one. He puts practice and theory perfectly, and has a unique way of assessing students. My highest recommendation for Dr. Perl.
The best professor ever. He is friendly with the marking and his classes are so mush fun.

Very straightforward class, Perl clearly and simply laid out the concepts of the course and the marking was fair. If you participate and grasp the main concepts of the course you will likely do well. Reading is not necessarily mandatory but it can help. Also watch episodes of Yes Minister which are interesting and cut the monotony of the class.

Perl is a good prof, although he says little in this class. Most students in this class weren't articulate. This seminar is left entirely up to the students to "teach," which most can't do. Most students don't do all the homework and can't discuss the material (they try to fake it though). It was a lame seminar. If you're smart, avoid this class.

Anthony Perl is an excellent professor. He is an expert in the policy sciences and is not biased. His class size is small and he runs a tight seminar  If you are the type of student who sits through seminars and never says anything, do everyone else a favour and don't take this class.

Anthony knows a lot about policy, but as many brilliant people are, he isn't very good at communicating what is going on in his head to others. For a fourth year class, it was pretty easy with little reading. Don't do what I did and express any ideas remotely right of centre (he is very left). Just agree with what he says and you'll do fine.

Awesome prof, would highly recommend to anyone.  A tad wordy for take home mid terms and finals, they tend to be fair and interesting.  At the end of each lecture we watched an episode of Yes, Minister, funny and surprisingly well connected to the topics discussed.  Perl ties modern policy problems together with readings to show the applicability.
